    <td width="100%">
      

<p><a href="/lgov"><img src="/lgov/images/bread_crum_home.jpg" width="55" height="15" vspace="1" alt="Home" border="0"></a><a href="/lgov/about"><img src="/lgov/images/bread_crum_about.jpg" width="57" height="15" vspace="1" alt="About" border="0"></a></p>
      </td>
  </tr>
  <tr valign="top">
    <td width="100%" bgcolor="#000000"><img src="/lgov/images/black_pix.jpg" width="1" height="1" alt=" "></td>
  </tr>
  <tr valign="top">
    <td width="100%">
      <p><br>



<TAG name="NAME" value="start"/>Joe Kernan<TAG name="NAME" value="end"/>, the oldest of nine children, graduated from <TAG name="SCHOOL" value="start"/>St. Joseph's High School<TAG name="SCHOOL" value="end"/> in South Bend.  He was a catcher on the baseball team at the <TAG name="SCHOOL" value="start"/>University of Notre Dame<TAG name="SCHOOL" value="end"/>, and graduated from there in 1968 with a <TAG name="DEGREE" value="start"/>degree in Government<TAG name="DEGREE" value="end"/>.  <br><br>

Kernan entered the <TAG name="PREVEMPL" value="start"/>United States Navy<TAG name="PREVEMPL" value="end"/> in 1969 and served as a <TAG name="PREVPOS" value="start"/>naval flight officer<TAG name="PREVPOS" value="end"/> aboard the U.S.S. Kitty Hawk.  In May of 1972, Kernan was shot down by the enemy while on a reconnaissance mission over North Vietnam.  He was held as a prisoner of war for 11 months.  Kernan was repatriated in 1973 and continued on active duty with the Navy until December of 1974.  For his service, Kernan received numerous awards, including the Navy Commendation Medal, two Purple Hearts and the Distinguished Flying Cross.<br><br>

After completing his Naval service, Kernan worked for <TAG name="PREVEMPL" value="start"/>Procter and Gamble<TAG name="PREVEMPL" value="end"/> in Cincinnati in 1975.  He then returned to South Bend, where he worked for both the <TAG name="PREVEMPL" value="start"/>Schwarz Paper Company<TAG name="PREVEMPL" value="end"/> and the <TAG name="PREVEMPL" value="start"/>MacWilliams Corporation<TAG name="PREVEMPL" value="end"/>.  He was <TAG name="PREVPOS" value="start"/>South Bend's city controller<TAG name="PREVPOS" value="end"/> from 1980 to 1984.<br><br>

<IMG HEIGHT=154 WIDTH=160 SRC="/lgov/images/gov_lgov.JPG"  VSPACE=0 HSPACE=17 ALIGN=right BORDER=0  ALT="gov_lgov" ><TAG name="NAME" value="start"/>Joe Kernan<TAG name="NAME" value="end"/> was elected <TAG name="PREVPOS" value="start"/>mayor of South Bend<TAG name="PREVPOS" value="end"/> in 1987.  He served as <TAG name="PREVPOS" value="start"/>mayor<TAG name="PREVPOS" value="end"/> for nine years, longer than any other <TAG name="PREVPOS" value="start"/>mayor<TAG name="PREVPOS" value="end"/> in the city's history.  <br><br>

In <TAG name="DATEELECTED" value="start"/>1996<TAG name="DATEELECTED" value="end"/>, <TAG name="TITLE" value="start"/>Lt. Governor<TAG name="TITLE" value="end"/> <TAG name="NAME" value="start"/>Joe Kernan<TAG name="NAME" value="end"/> and Governor Frank O'Bannon were elected to the top two positions in <TAG name="STATE" value="start"/>Indiana<TAG name="STATE" value="end"/> government.  As <TAG name="POSITION" value="start"/>lieutenant governor of <TAG name="STATE" value="start"/>Indiana<TAG name="STATE" value="end"/><TAG name="POSITION" value="end"/>, Kernan serves as the president of the <TAG name="STATE" value="start"/>Indiana<TAG name="STATE" value="end"/> Senate, the director of the <TAG name="STATE" value="start"/>Indiana<TAG name="STATE" value="end"/> Department of Commerce and as the commissioner of Agriculture.<br><br>

Among Lt. Governor Kernan's accomplishments:  
<ul type="disc">
<li> <i>Jobs Council:</i>  In 1997, the lieutenant governor led the most thorough and inclusive review of the state's economic development programs to date.  The Jobs Council process, which included input from 75 men and women statewide, has resulted in changes that make <TAG name="STATE" value="start"/>Indiana<TAG name="STATE" value="end"/>'s economic development tools more efficient, more accountable, more targeted and more customer-service oriented than ever before.<br><br>

<li> <i>Agricultural Crisis Working Group:</i>  In 1998, Kernan led the effort to pull together support for farmers who struggled through some of darkest times in the agricultural industry's history.  What first began as simply the Pork Crisis Working Group is now a bipartisan group of men and women who are on call to assist whenever necessary.<br><br>

<li> <i>Commencement Speaker:</i>  Also that year, the lieutenant governor was honored by his alma mater when he was chosen as the commencement speaker for the <TAG name="SCHOOL" value="start"/>University of Notre Dame<TAG name="SCHOOL" value="end"/>'s graduation ceremonies.  He was awarded an <TAG name="DEGREE" value="start"/>honorary doctorate<TAG name="DEGREE" value="end"/> during the event.<br><br>

<li> <i>Reaching Out to Fellow Veterans:</i>  Lt. Governor Kernan launched the Veterans Outreach Initiative in 1999 - an effort to encourage veterans to take advantage of the state and federal benefits that they have earned by serving their country.  Thousands of veterans have received information from the lieutenant governor, outlining their benefits and how to go about accessing them.   <br><br>

<li> <i>International Trade:</i>  Under Kernan's direction, the state has stepped up its international presence.  In 1999, <TAG name="STATE" value="start"/>Indiana<TAG name="STATE" value="end"/> set a record for exporting:  $14 billion worth of Hoosier goods were shipped outside the state.  Four new overseas trade offices have opened during the lieutenant governor's time in office, bringing the total to 12 worldwide.<br><br>

<li> <i>Business Attraction and Expansion:</i>  The <TAG name="STATE" value="start"/>Indiana<TAG name="STATE" value="end"/> Department of Commerce has helped bring 66 new companies, and assisted in the expansion of 687 existing companies with the lieutenant governor at the helm.  These projects have impacted more than 200,000 Hoosier jobs.  Major successes include expansions at Eli Lilly and Company in Indianapolis and Toyota Motor Manufacturing in Princeton, plus new development for AM General in St. Joseph County, Sofamor Danek in Warsaw and Covance Inc. in Indianapolis.    <br><br>

<IMG HEIGHT=202 WIDTH=211 SRC="/lgov/images/jmk_election_91.JPG"  VSPACE=7 HSPACE=10 ALIGN=RIGHT BORDER=0  ALT="jmk_election_91" ><li> <i>The 21st Century Research and Technology Fund:</i>  Kernan is chairman of the fund, established in 1999, which supports new business development in the high-tech, high-paying sectors of biomedical research and computer technology.  In the first round of funding, more than $15 million in grants were awarded to 13 companies, leveraging more than $40 million in matching funds.  <br><br>
</ul>
Joe and his wife, <TAG name="SPOUSE" value="start"/>Maggie<TAG name="SPOUSE" value="end"/>, were married in <TAG name="DOM" value="start"/>1974<TAG name="DOM" value="end"/>.  They have a home in <TAG name="RESCITY" value="start"/>South Bend<TAG name="RESCITY" value="end"/>, where Maggie works for 1st Source Bank.  She is a Purdue University graduate, who is now a senior vice-president and the director of marketing at the bank.  Maggie is also active in community service, and has been mentoring a child for five years through a South Bend Community Schools program.<br><br>




 </td>
  </tr>
  <tr valign="top">
    <td><img name="subs_r14_c1" src="/lgov/images/subs_r14_c1.jpg" width="204" height="27" border="0" alt=" "></td>
    <td><img name="subs_r14_c4" src="/lgov/images/subs_r14_c4.jpg" width="421" height="27" border="0" alt=" "></td>
  </tr>

</table>


</body>

</html>


ENDOFDOC

<title>Biography</title>

<body bgcolor="#ffffff" onload="MM_preloadImages('/gov/firstlady/images/subs_a_f2.jpg','/gov/firstlady/images/subs_b_f2.jpg','/gov/firstlady/images/subs_c_f2.jpg','/gov/firstlady/images/subs_d_f2.jpg','/gov/firstlady/images/subs_e_f2.jpg','/gov/firstlady/images/subs_f_f2.jpg','/gov/firstlady/images/subs_g_f2.jpg');" leftmargin=0 topmargin=0 marginwidth=0 marginheight=0>
<table border=0 cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 width=635>
<tr valign=top>
<td colspan=2><img name=subs_photo src="/gov/firstlady/images/subs_photo.jpg" width=635 height=141 border=0 usemap="#subs_photoMap"><map name="subs_photoMap"></map></td>

<td><table border=0 cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 width=195>
<tr valign=top>
<td><a href="/gov/firstlady/bio/index.html" onmouseout="MM_swapImgRestore();" onmouseover="MM_swapImage('subs_a','','/gov/firstlady/images/subs_a_f2.jpg',1);"><img name=subs_a src="/gov/firstlady/images/subs_a.jpg" width=195 height=18 border=0 alt="Biography"></a></td>

<tr valign=top>
<td><a href="/gov/about/index.html" onmouseout="MM_swapImgRestore();" onmouseover="MM_swapImage('subs_b','','/gov/firstlady/images/subs_b_f2.jpg',1);"><img name=subs_b src="/gov/firstlady/images/subs_b.jpg" width=195 height=18 border=0 alt="About Indiana"></a></td></tr>

</tr>
<tr valign=top>
<td><a href="/gov/firstlady/contact/index.html" onmouseout="MM_swapImgRestore();" onmouseover="MM_swapImage('subs_e','','/gov/firstlady/images/subs_e_f2.jpg',1);"><img name="subs_e" src="/gov/firstlady/images/subs_e.jpg" width="195" height="18" border="0" Contact teh First Lady"></a></td>
</tr>
<tr valign=top>
<td><a href="/gov/firstlady/residence/index.html" onmouseout="MM_swapImgRestore();" onmouseover="MM_swapImage('subs_f','','/gov/firstlady/images/subs_f_f2.jpg',1);"><img name=subs_f src="/gov/firstlady/images/subs_f.jpg" width=195 height=18 border=0 alt="Visit the Governor's Residence"></a></td>
</tr>
<tr valign=top>
<td><a href="http://www.ai.org/serv/presscal?PF=frstlady&Clist=123" onmouseout="MM_swapImgRestore();" onmouseover="MM_swapImage('subs_g','','/gov/firstlady/images/subs_g_f2.jpg',1);"><img name=subs_g src="/gov/firstlady/images/subs_g.jpg" width=195 height=20 border=0 alt="News"></a></td>
</tr>
<tr valign=top>
<td><img name=subs_end src="/gov/firstlady/images/subs_end.jpg" width=195 height=51 border=0></td>
</tr>
</table>
<center><img src="/gov/firstlady/images/port.jpg" width=157 height=220 alt="First Lady Judy O'Bannon"></center>
</td>
<td valign=top>
<center><img name=subs_title src="/gov/firstlady/images/subs_title.jpg" width=440 height=36 border=0></center>
<font face="Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size=2>
<p>
<img src="../images/judyvol1.gif" width=183 height=126 alt="" border=0 align=right alt="First Lady volunteers">
<TAG name="NAME" value="start"/>Judy O'Bannon<TAG name="NAME" value="end"/>, wife of Governor <TAG name="SPOUSE" value="start"/>Frank O'Bannon<TAG name="SPOUSE" value="end"/>, has spent her life working on behalf of <TAG name="STATE" value="start"/>Indiana<TAG name="STATE" value="end"/>'s communities. Based on this experience, Judy approaches her role as <TAG name="POSITION" value="start"/><TAG name="STATE" value="start"/>Indiana<TAG name="STATE" value="end"/>'s First Lady<TAG name="POSITION" value="end"/> with the vision of "Communities Building Community."
<p>As chair of the 25-member <TAG name="STATE" value="start"/>Indiana<TAG name="STATE" value="end"/> 2016 Task Force, formerly the Hoosier Millennium initiative, Judy is encouraging Hoosiers to set the state's 200th birthday in 2016 as a target date for achieving long-term goals. The task force is initiating and supporting opportunities that help strengthen <TAG name="STATE" value="start"/>Indiana<TAG name="STATE" value="end"/> and encourage citizen participation, with a special focus in the areas of education, the environment, early childhood development, arts and culture, technology and community development.
<p>As a result of her work to strengthen communities, Judy was asked by People to People Ambassador programs to lead a delegation from <TAG name="STATE" value="start"/>Indiana<TAG name="STATE" value="end"/> to Russia in October 1999. While in the cities of Moscow, Novgorod and St. Petersburg, the 19-member delegation met with public officials and other leaders who are working to start or expand not-for-profit organizations, volunteer centers, public-private partnership opportunities and other community-building efforts. Mrs. O'Bannon has been asked by People to People to lead another community building delegation to South Africa in the fall of 2001.
<p><img src="../images/garden4.gif" width=132 height=170 alt="" border=0 align=left>Judy refers to the Governor's Residence as the "State's Living Room." She has initiated and welcomed a variety of community activities, which include: using the Residence's gardens for a mentor program involving youth and volunteer gardeners and celebrating contemporary Hoosier artists by rotating artwork through the Residence from galleries around the state. She also hosts annually "A Day of the Arts at the Governor's Residence," which brings more than 400 special needs children to the Residence. Co-hosted by Very Special Arts <TAG name="STATE" value="start"/>Indiana<TAG name="STATE" value="end"/>, the event provides visual and performing arts activities which increase learning ability and enhance quality of life.
<p>Judy is a member, and past chair, of the <TAG name="STATE" value="start"/>Indiana<TAG name="STATE" value="end"/> Main Street Council; the Advisory Board of the National Trust for Historic Preservation; and the Executive Board of the Historic Landmarks Foundation of <TAG name="STATE" value="start"/>Indiana<TAG name="STATE" value="end"/>. She also has served on the <TAG name="STATE" value="start"/>Indiana<TAG name="STATE" value="end"/> Arts Commission and was a founding member of the Advisory Board of Silvercrest Children's Development Center. Through her husband's involvement in politics, Judy co-founded Partners in Politics, a support and information group for family members of public officeholders.
<p>Judy graduated Phi Beta Kappa in 1957 from <TAG name="SCHOOL" value="start"/>Indiana University<TAG name="SCHOOL" value="end"/> with a <TAG name="DEGREE" value="start"/>bachelor's degree in social work<TAG name="DEGREE" value="end"/>. She was selected as a Rockefeller Theological Scholar and was the first woman to attend the Louisville Presbyterian Theological Seminary. Judy has been recognized for her achievements on behalf of the State of <TAG name="STATE" value="start"/>Indiana<TAG name="STATE" value="end"/> with honorary degrees from <TAG name="SCHOOL" value="start"/>Saint Mary-of-the-Woods College<TAG name="SCHOOL" value="end"/>, the <TAG name="SCHOOL" value="start"/>University of Southern Indiana<TAG name="SCHOOL" value="end"/> and <TAG name="SCHOOL" value="start"/>Vincennes University<TAG name="SCHOOL" value="end"/>.
<p>The O'Bannons have three children and four grandchildren.
<p><center><font size=1>Photos courtesy of Kathy Petrere</font></center>
</font>
<p><br><hr>
<br><br>
</td></tr>
</table>
</body>
